howItWorks.question: How does channel monitoring work?
howItWorks.answer:
How it works:
1. Bot connects to Telegram via API
2. Tracks new messages in specified channels
3. Checks messages for keyword matches (if configured)
4. Adds matching messages to publication queue
5. Publishes messages to specified publication channels

Technical details:
‚Ä¢ Public channels use a shared monitoring account
‚Ä¢ Private channels require personal account connection
‚Ä¢ Messages are processed asynchronously via Redis queue
‚Ä¢ Delay between message processing is minimal

channelsLimit.question: How many channels can I monitor?
channelsLimit.answer:
Plan limits:
‚Ä¢ Demo: up to 50 channels, up to 50 keyword queries (valid for 10 days)
‚Ä¢ Light: up to 50 channels, up to 50 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Medium: up to 100 channels, up to 100 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Hard: up to 200 channels, up to 200 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Rock: up to 500 channels, up to 200 keyword queries

What counts:
‚Ä¢ Monitoring channels (where messages come from)
‚Ä¢ Publication channels (where messages are published)
‚Ä¢ Total = monitoring channels + publication channels

privateChannels.question: Can I monitor private channels?
privateChannels.answer:
Yes, with conditions:
‚Ä¢ Requires personal Telegram account connection
‚Ä¢ Requires paid plan (Light, Medium, Hard, Rock)
‚Ä¢ Need access to channel (subscription or invite link)

How to add private channel:
1. Connect personal account
2. Get invite link to channel
3. Send invite link to bot
4. Bot will automatically subscribe to channel via your account

Limitations:
‚Ä¢ Private channels can only be monitored via personal account
‚Ä¢ Demo plan does not support private channels
‚Ä¢ Channel notifications are automatically disabled

speed.question: How fast do messages arrive after publication?
speed.answer:
Processing speed:
‚Ä¢ Usually messages are published within seconds after appearing in source channel
‚Ä¢ Delay depends on server load and task queue
‚Ä¢ Average: 5-30 seconds

Factors affecting speed:
‚Ä¢ Number of messages being processed
‚Ä¢ Server load
‚Ä¢ Telegram API delays
‚Ä¢ Number of monitoring channels

howKeywordsWork.question: How do keywords work?
howKeywordsWork.answer:
How it works:
1. Bot extracts text from message
2. Checks text for keyword matches
3. If at least one match found - message is published
4. If no matches - message is not published

Features:
‚Ä¢ Search is case-insensitive (by default)
‚Ä¢ Partial word search
‚Ä¢ Search through entire message text

Example:
Keyword: "bitcoin"
Message: "Bitcoin reached new maximum"
Result: ‚úÖ Match found

regex.question: Can I use regular expressions?
regex.answer:
Current version:
‚Ä¢ Regular expressions are not supported
‚Ä¢ All keywords are searched as plain text

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ Regular expression support
‚Ä¢ "Use regex" option when adding keyword
‚Ä¢ Examples: bitcoin|ethereum, \d+, [A-Z]+

exactMatch.question: How to search for exact word match?
exactMatch.answer:
Current version:
‚Ä¢ By default partial word search
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will find: "bitcoin", "bitcoins", "cryptobitcoin"

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ "Search whole word" option
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will only find: "bitcoin", "bitcoin.", "bitcoin,", but not "bitcoins"

Temporary solution:
‚Ä¢ Use more specific keywords
‚Ä¢ Combine multiple words for exact search

caseSensitive.question: Is case sensitivity considered?
caseSensitive.answer:
Current behavior:
‚Ä¢ By default search is case-insensitive
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will find: "bitcoin", "Bitcoin", "BITCOIN", "BiTcOiN"

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ Case sensitivity setting
‚Ä¢ "Consider case" option when adding keyword

multipleChannels.question: Can I publish to multiple channels simultaneously?
multipleChannels.answer:
Yes:
‚Ä¢ Can create multiple publication channels
‚Ä¢ Each channel is configured independently
‚Ä¢ One message can be published to multiple channels simultaneously

Configuration:
‚Ä¢ Each publication channel is configured separately
‚Ä¢ Can use different keywords for different channels
‚Ä¢ Can use different publication formats

format.question: Which publication format is better to use?
format.answer:
Forward (forward original):
‚úÖ Preserves authorship and source
‚úÖ Subscribers see source
‚ùå Shows that message was forwarded
Use for: news channels, channels with original content

Copy (copy-paste):
‚úÖ Message looks original
‚úÖ Can hide source
‚ùå Loses author information
Use for: news aggregators, anonymous channels

Recommendation:
‚Ä¢ For news channels - Forward
‚Ä¢ For aggregators - Copy with source link
‚Ä¢ For anonymous channels - Copy without link

forwardVsCopy.question: What's the difference between Forward and Copy?
forwardVsCopy.answer:
Forward (forward original):
‚úÖ Preserves authorship and source
‚úÖ Subscribers see source channel
‚úÖ Maintains original formatting
‚ùå Shows that message was forwarded
‚ùå Depends on access to original

Copy (copy-paste):
‚úÖ Message looks original
‚úÖ Can hide source
‚úÖ Independent of original
‚ùå Loses author information
‚ùå May lose formatting

Use Forward for:
‚Ä¢ News channels
‚Ä¢ Channels with original content
‚Ä¢ When source transparency is important

Use Copy for:
‚Ä¢ News aggregators
‚Ä¢ Anonymous channels
‚Ä¢ When original may be deleted

keywordFiltering.question: How does keyword filtering work?
keywordFiltering.answer:
How it works:
1. Bot extracts text from message
2. Checks for keyword matches
3. If match found - message is published
4. If no match - message is skipped

Features:
‚Ä¢ Case-insensitive search (by default)
‚Ä¢ Partial word matching
‚Ä¢ Searches entire message text
‚Ä¢ At least one keyword match is enough

Example:

Message: "Stock market news"

‚Ä¢ When trying to connect same account to another user, previous session will disconnect

Recommendations:
‚Ä¢ Use separate account for each bot user
‚Ä¢ This ensures security and independence of settings

disconnect.question: How to disconnect personal account?
disconnect.answer:
How to disconnect:
1. Go to "üîå Connect personal account"
2. Click "üî¥ Disconnect session"
3. Confirm disconnection

channelNotFound.question: Channel not found
channelNotFound.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Incorrect channel username
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Channel is private and no access

Solutions:
1. Check username correctness (without @)
2. Make sure channel exists and is accessible
3. For private channels - connect personal account
4. Try using full link: https://t.me/username

limitReached.question: Error "Channel limit reached"
limitReached.answer:
Cause:
‚Ä¢ Exceeded channel limit for your plan

Solutions:
1. Delete unused channels
2. Or choose plan with higher limit

How to check limit:
1. Go to "üí≥ Limits"
2. Check line "Channels: X / Y"

noMessages.question: Messages not arriving
noMessages.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Channel not added to monitoring
‚Ä¢ Keywords not configured (if filtering used)
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Connection problems

Solutions:
1. Check that channel is added to monitoring channels list
2. Check filtering settings (keywords or repost all)
3. Make sure channel exists and is accessible
4. Check internet connection
5. Restart bot (command /start)

notPublishing.question: Messages not publishing to channel
notPublishing.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Bot is not channel administrator
‚Ä¢ Bot has insufficient permissions
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Monitoring channels not configured

Solutions:
1. Check that bot is added as administrator
2. Check bot permissions (should have "Post messages")
3. Make sure channel exists and is active
4. Check monitoring channels settings
5. Click "Check permissions" in channel menu

keywordsNotWorking.question: Keywords not working
keywordsNotWorking.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Keywords not added
‚Ä¢ Incorrect keyword spelling
‚Ä¢ Keywords not applied to publication channel

Solutions:
1. Check keywords list
2. Make sure keywords are added to publication channel
3. Check keyword spelling
4. Try adding keywords again

delay.question: Messages arrive with delay
delay.answer:
Normal behavior:
‚Ä¢ Delay of 5-30 seconds is normal
‚Ä¢ Depends on server load and task queue

If delay is too long:
1. Check internet connection
2. Check server load (may be temporary)
3. Contact support if delay is constant

Optimization:
‚Ä¢ Bot uses asynchronous processing
‚Ä¢ Task queue is processed continuously
‚Ä¢ Delays possible under high load

channelNotMonitored.question: Some channels are not being monitored
channelNotMonitored.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Channel removed from monitoring
‚Ä¢ Channel blocked or unavailable
‚Ä¢ Connection problems
‚Ä¢ Channel is private and no access

Solutions:
1. Check monitoring channels list
2. Make sure channel exists and is accessible

4. Try removing and adding channel again

Check:
‚Ä¢ Open channel in Telegram
‚Ä¢ Verify channel is accessible
‚Ä¢ Check monitoring settings in bot

botNotAdmin.question: Error "Bot is not administrator"
botNotAdmin.answer:
Cause:
‚Ä¢ Bot not added as administrator or removed

Solutions:
1. Add bot as channel administrator
2. Enable "Post messages" permission
3. Click "Check permissions" in channel menu in bot

How to add bot:
1. Open channel settings in Telegram
2. Go to "Administrators"
3. Click "Add administrator"
4. Find @radar_telegram_bot
5. Enable "Post messages"
6. Click "Done"

accountDisconnected.question: Account disconnected by itself
accountDisconnected.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Session expired (rare)
‚Ä¢ Server problems
‚Ä¢ Telegram password changed
‚Ä¢ Connection issues

Solutions:
1. Reconnect account
2. Check Telegram security settings
3. Contact support if problem repeats

Prevention:
‚Ä¢ Regularly check connection status
‚Ä¢ Don't change Telegram password unnecessarily
‚Ä¢ Report problems to support

effectiveKeywords.question: How to create effective keywords?
effectiveKeywords.answer:
Principles:
‚Ä¢ Use specific words, not general ones
‚Ä¢ Avoid too short words (less than 3 characters)
‚Ä¢ Combine multiple words for precise search
‚Ä¢ Consider synonyms and spelling variants

Examples:
‚ùå Bad: "news", "crypto"
‚úÖ Good: "bitcoin", "ethereum", "cryptocurrency"

Tips:
‚Ä¢ Use words that accurately describe needed content
‚Ä¢ Add spelling variants (e.g., "bitcoin" and "–±–∏—Ç–∫–æ–∏–Ω")
‚Ä¢ Exclude words that may give many false positives
‚Ä¢ Test keywords and adjust based on results

thematicChannels.question: How to organize publication channels?
thematicChannels.answer:
Principle:
‚Ä¢ Create separate channels for different topics
‚Ä¢ Use different keywords for each channel
‚Ä¢ Configure channels independently

Example:
Channel "Cryptocurrencies":
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitoring channels: Cryptonews, BitcoinNews
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Keywords: bitcoin, ethereum, cryptocurrency

Channel "Technology":
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitoring channels: TechNews, ITChannel
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Keywords: technology, IT, programming

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Subscribers get only relevant content
‚Ä¢ Easier content management
‚Ä¢ Can configure different publication formats
‚Ä¢ Better organization

bulkAddChannels.question: How to efficiently add multiple channels?
bulkAddChannels.answer:
Tips:
‚Ä¢ Add channels in groups separated by comma
‚Ä¢ Use automatic queue (built-in)
‚Ä¢ Check channel list after adding

Example:
Instead of adding one by one:
1. Add cryptonews
2. Wait
3. Add bitcoin
...

Use:
Add: cryptonews, bitcoin, ethereum, blockchain
(All channels added automatically with delay)

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Saves time
‚Ä¢ Protection from flood limits
‚Ä¢ Convenient management

How it works:
‚Ä¢ Channels added to queue automatically
‚Ä¢ Processing with 3-5 second delay between channels
‚Ä¢ You get notification when complete
